title: How to Learn Macro Photography

steps.headline: Go to the library.
steps.description: The library is a good place to find some books that will tell you a little bit about shooting macros. Alternatively, get some ebooks on your Kindle or iPad, or whatever you have.

steps.headline: Don't invest a lot of money in it at first.
steps.description:
You can get your macro feet wet with a few inexpensive tools. Some of them are:
Extension Tubes
Reversal Rings

Beanbag Tripod (fun to make too)
Reflector

steps.headline: Understand what you need for shooting macro.
steps.description:
You need:
Strong support for your camera
Method of providing some fairly strong light
Ability to increase and decrease the aperture

steps.headline: Carefully put together your chosen tools and start practicing.

text:
Go to the library. The library is a good place to find some books that will tell you a little bit about shooting macros. Alternatively, get some ebooks on your Kindle or iPad, or whatever you have. Don't invest a lot of money in it at first. You can get your macro feet wet with a few inexpensive tools. Some of them are:
Extension Tubes
Reversal Rings

Beanbag Tripod (fun to make too)
Reflector Understand what you need for shooting macro. You need:
Strong support for your camera
Method of providing some fairly strong light
Ability to increase and decrease the aperture Carefully put together your chosen tools and start practicing.
